definition: The attribution of human feelings and responses onto non-human objects; objects mirror the mood of people.
mnemonic: It was pathetic, she thought it was fabulous that she loved the sea (pathetic fallacy), and was convinced the sea had fallen in love with her, but how could the sea have human feelings?
